title: Food Marketing to Children
description: A 60-second lesson on Food Marketing to Children.

hook.text: Kids see an average of 13 food ads per day. Nearly all promote sugary, salty, or fatty products.

buildup.text: Cartoon mascots, bright colors, and toy prizes create emotional bonds between children and brands.

discovery.text: Children as young as 2 recognize brand logos â€” and prefer food in branded packaging over identical unbranded food.

twist.text: Studies show kids rate identical cookies as tastier when the package has a cartoon character on it.

climax.text: Several countries have banned junk food ads targeting children â€” Sweden led in 1991, Chile followed in 2016.

punchline.text: Kids don't choose junk food. Marketing chooses it for them.

quiz.question: At what age can children recognize brand logos?
